item.title: Kaiju Point Standings
item.content:encoded:
These points are used for purchasing kaiju drops, when they become available. You can obtain points in the following ways:

Attacking a kaiju: +1 pt. per attack (top 10% of attackers on a kaiju get double points)
Spying on another village: +3 pt. per spy placed

For duplicate kaiju drops (all but 5 of them), the system will work like this. Base cost will be kaiju's health divided by 25. In the event that more than one person has enough points to buy the item, people should send me 1 message saying how much they're willing to spend on it. The item will go to the person who bid the most, but they will only have to pay the amount the second place bidder bid + 1 point (minimum of the item's cost). If that's a tie, it goes to whoever has more points then. If no one wants to buy an item with points, it goes in the claw machine.

You can still bid on items that are in the claw machine, assuming no one has won them yet. If someone bids the minimum bid for the item when it's in the claw machine, I take it out of the claw machine and send it to them. Otherwise, you're welcome to try and spend ryo to win it.

item.title: On Monsters
item.content:encoded:
Does anyone object to a rule that everyone in the village has to attack at least once a day if there's currently a kaiju alive? Failure to do so could result in the loss of access to upgrades / storehouse.

Kaiju are seriously nasty now. The Fox Demon is reported to have 30,000 health (in addition to it's regenerating and increasing in strength). I imagine the Sand Demon is the same. Expect the Storm Riders and other 20k monsters to have 30,000 at this point. I don't think we can toy around with them like we used to.

However, I still think we need to be killing monsters regularly (including enticement monsters). We still don't have Super Robots, which are Enticement only, and their upgrade gives 20% off arena reputation items, which is huge. We really need to keep enticing until we get that upgrade, at the very least.

However, I'm not willing to summon them if they're going to start being a real threat to our upgrades. So, the alternative to having a rule that says "You must attack once a day." is to just stop summoning monsters. I'd rather not do this, but if you guys are really uncomfortable with the "You have to attack once a day" rule, then going without summons might be the best way to go.

item.title: On Duplicate Monster Drops
item.content:encoded:
So, I was thinking about a new system which is a little less arbitrary than our current system when dealing out duplicate monster drops. Here's what I was thinking…

Whenever you successfully plant a spy, you get +3 points
Whenever you successfully invade, you get +5 points
Whenever you attack a monster, you get +2 points

You keep your points until you get a monster drop. Whenever there's a duplicate monster drop that I can give out, whoever has the highest points currently gets first choice at it. They can pass to the next person, until eventually someone takes it. The points awarded as roughly the amount of stamina spent helping the village.

Doing it this way would (1) reward people who help the village out the most get more monster drops, rather than the guy who just happened to get lucky on this particular summon, and (2) spread the monster drops out a little more evenly, (3) encourage people to wack at monsters even if they don't want that particular drop.

I've got a script that can parse the combat log for these events and award points based on them. Effectively, I can parse the chatlog for the events, then delete them, then post the updated numbers to the forums so everyone knows where everyone else stands at any given time.

Thoughts?
